intro: Rabdosia scrophularioides, commonly known as the Chinese blue flag, is a perennial herb native to East Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, characterized by its square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, with opposite leaves that are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small, tubular, and usually blue or purple, arranged in whorled clusters at the ends of the stems. Rabdosia scrophularioides is often used in traditional medicine and as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and hardy nature.
